info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 6:31PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Otsego, eastern Broome, west central Delaware, southeastern Cortland and Chenango Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 631 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from East Freetown to near Willet to near Greene to near Conklin. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 35 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Binghamton, Norwich, Kirkwood, Conklin, Sidney, Guilford, Sanford, Deposit, Coventry and Port Dickinson. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 between 1 and 4 South, and near 6. Interstate 86/Route 17 between 75 and 84. Interstate 88 between 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
